channel.title: Homelab on Cory J Popp
channel.description: Recent content in Homelab on Cory J Popp

item.title: From Bus Stops to Endpoints: Lessons in Reliability
item.description: A tiny ESP32 bus-time display project shows why fallback, retries, and communication are just as critical in endpoint engineering as they are in IoT gadgets.

item.title: Deploying Custom Apps with Intune via Win32
item.description: Testing Win32 app deployment in Intune using 7-Zip as a custom installer. A hands-on homelab experiment in automation and detection logic.

item.title: Setting up a Homelab for Endpoint Engineering
item.description:
I’ve wanted to really understand Microsoft’s cloud stack for a while, but reading docs and watching tutorials only gets you so far. Things are always shifting: product name changes, services getting folded into one another, best practices evolve. Before long, everything you just learned is out of date.

So I decided to stop reading about it and start doing. I’m building this homelab as my sandbox where I can try, break, rebuild, and finally, understand what works (and why).
